entry.title: Combined summary - [c-lightning] Welcoming a New C-lightning Core Team Member!
entry.summary: During a Lightning-dev discussion, a user named ZmnSCPxj raised concerns about the usage of GPG. The user mentioned that they were having difficulty setting up GPG satisfactorily but would make an effort if necessary. A request was made to know the specific difficulties faced by the user. It is unclear what the context of the post was, but it appears to relate to security concerns around commits to the Lightning Network project. The post includes a link to a previous discussion on the topic. Additionally, the thread also includes a signature attachment of type 'application/pgp-signature' from Peter Todd's email. In a message posted to the Lightning Development mailing list, ZmnSCPxj questioned whether his GPG setup was satisfactory and suggested that his commit access be revoked if necessary. It is important for individuals working on projects like the Lightning Network to ensure that their GPG setup is adequate in order to maintain the security of the project. While it may require some effort to set up GPG satisfactorily, it is a worthwhile investment to prevent security breaches.
